home.title: We will not forget them
home.subtitle: Documenting and humanising the Gaza genocide.

home.contributeText: Contribute missing information and help remember their lives

about.title: About
about.mission: Gaza Witnesses has as its mission to memorialise those dead and missing in Gaza since Oct. 7, 2023. The platform combines many data sources, notably the official MoH reports and enables community contributions.
about.purpose: The underlying purpose behind the platform, and mission, is to establish a canonical historical document of the human costs in Gaza. This document, and archive, will serve as a resource for international justice, historical accountability, political activism, artistic expression, and collective memory.
about.belief: We believe that remembering is both an ethical and political act.
about.teamSubtitle: A diverse team committed to preserving the memory of every life lost

yousef.title: Director of video

involved.q: Who is involved in this project?
involved.a: An informal advisory team (see page) has been formed that is establishing a charity in the UK that will hold all of the data and assets. This group will also establish Memorandum and Articles of Association, Code of Conduct, and Editorial Principles.

dataSources.a: The Palestinian Ministry of Health (MoH) is our primary source of truth. They periodically release updated lists of identified individuals killed in Gaza. We maintain a complete archive of all MoH data releases in our
dataSources.a2: ensuring full transparency and allowing anyone to verify our data against the original source materials.

ownership.q: Who owns the data and how can it be used?
ownership.a: All of the data will be licensed and available to the public as easy downloadable files. The data and the technology platform is covered by open source and open data licensing.

funding.a: Already confirmed funding is sufficient to enable this project to reach its first milestone. From that point onwards it will require fundraising for its ongoing expenses (primarily technology infrastructure).

iraqBodyCount.q: What is your relationship to Iraq Body Count?
iraqBodyCount.a: Iraq Body Count has been doing the highly important work of documenting, and quantifying, human suffering from war since 2002. They have written extensively about their process on their substack and x accounts.

tech4palestine.q: What is your relationship to Tech4Palestine?
tech4palestine.a: Tech4Palestine is a movement and a community. They are doing fantastic work in the technology sector and we are proud to be part of their ecosystem. They have their own tracking of the MoH data releases which we have made use of.

moh.q: What is your relationship to the Gaza Ministry of Health?
moh.a: Understandably, the Gaza MoH is very stretched currently and is providing their updates on deaths in their Telegram channel through PDFs. Today we have no partnership or open channel with them.

edit.title: Contribute Information
edit.description: Help us preserve the memory of this person by adding missing information. All submissions are reviewed by our moderation team before being published.
edit.optionalFields: Optional: Add or update the following information
edit.locationInstructions: Click on the map to set the location, or enter coordinates manually
edit.photoInstructions: Upload a clear portrait photo (max 10MB, JPG/PNG/WebP)
edit.reasonPlaceholder: Please explain why you are making these changes (required)
edit.successMessage: Your contribution has been submitted and is now pending review by our moderation team.
edit.validationError: Please provide at least one change and a reason
